124.speaker: Lae'zel
124.text: 'The Blade of Frontiers.' One might think you finished where you started.

9.speaker: Shadowheart
9.text: The Blade of Frontiers', eh? No need to tamper with the classics, I suppose.

51.speaker: Wyll
51.text: An old name, for certain. But a new man to bear it.

29.speaker: Wyll
29.text: The four pillars finally rise within me. Courage, Insight, strategy, justice.

118.speaker: Wyll
118.text: I'm not to abide them, but to become them.

74.speaker: Wyll
74.text: A hero is not just - he is justice. He is not courageous - he is courage.

49.speaker: Wyll
49.text: Ah, but enough reflection for today. I'm of a mind to celebrate.

5.speaker: Wyll
5.text: Wonderful. You hunt the deer, I'll scrounge up the ale. Prepare your belly for roast a la Blade!

109.speaker: Player
109.text: Let's not get ahead of ourselves. We've got an elder brain to deal with, remember?

69.speaker: Player
69.text: Better make room for Mizora in that little party of yours.

120.speaker: Wyll
120.text: You hunt the meat, I'll scrounge up the ale. Prepare your belly for roast a la Blade!

114.speaker: Player
114.text: Eh, I'll leave you to it.

92.speaker: Player
92.text: There's more to your plans than you're letting on, isn't there?

115.speaker: Wyll
115.text: I won't let her claim one more soul, slay one more victim. I'm going to make my way to the Hells and tear the horns right off her damned head.

91.speaker: Player
91.text: Are you sure you're ready? Once we deal with the brain, Mizora will take your powers.

127.speaker: Wyll
127.text: Father trained me in the sword and the bow. They'll have to sustain me.

70.speaker: Player
70.text: You need to destroy her. She doesn't deserve any better.

108.speaker: Wyll
108.text: Damn right. I'll cut her to ribbons before she can so much as groan Zariel's name.

154.speaker: Player
154.text: Let it go, Wyll. There are better ways to help the people of the Sword Coast.

23.speaker: Wyll
23.text: Part of me wants to argue. To insist that I'd be killing Mizora for the good of the Coast.

88.speaker: Wyll
88.text: But I can't. Not when I know I'm killing her out of revenge.

17.speaker: Wyll
17.text: You're right - I won't target Mizora. But should she cross my path in Avernus, I'll cut her to ribbons before she can so much as groan Zariel's name.

52.speaker: Wyll
52.text: You're right - I need to forget Mizora. The people of the Coast call to the Blade. I can't let myself stray from them.

37.speaker: Wyll
37.text: I will return to Avernus. And I'll cut Mizora to ribbons before she can so much as groan Zariel's name.

71.speaker: Player
71.text: What are your plans as the Blade, once the brain is defeated?

89.speaker: Wyll
89.text: I scout both the Hells and the Coast's havens. And I destroy every fiend that dares put its eye on Faerûn.

145.speaker: Wyll
145.text: I do what I do best. Answering the calls of the needful, killing the monsters that haunt them -

33.speaker: Wyll
33.text: - and showing them they won't be abandoned.

110.speaker: Narrator
110.text: *Wyll takes a sharp breath. He's keeping something from you.*

66.speaker: Player
66.text: What are your plans as the Blade, once the brain is defeated? What about us?

34.speaker: Wyll
34.text: I love the Coast, I love its people. The Blade of Avernus will toil for them...

20.speaker: Wyll
20.text: ... but he'd rather not toil alone.

68.speaker: Wyll
68.text: Faerûn doesn't need just one hero. It needs two. Say you'll fight with me.

140.speaker: Wyll
140.text: You make me so proud. And when the elder brain falls, the people of the Sword Coast will see what I see:

54.speaker: Player
54.text: That's not a choice I'm ready to make yet.

46.speaker: Player
46.text: I have other priorities, other plans for my life. I'm sorry.

30.speaker: Wyll
30.text: I love the Coast, I love its people. The Blade of Frontiers belongs to them...

143.speaker: Wyll
143.text: ... but Wyll Ravengard belongs to you.

101.speaker: Astarion
101.text: So, 'the Blade of Frontiers'? You didn't want to trade it for a flashier name?

105.speaker: Gale
105.text: So, you didn't fancy sharpening up the old moniker? I'd have thought the 'Blade of Frontiers' might be feeling a bit dull after all you've been through.

83.speaker: Karlach
83.text: 'The Blade of Frontiers.' That's what you were called before I barrelled into your life and nearly ruined it. And look at you now.

45.speaker: Halsin
45.text: The Blade of Frontiers'. It seems you have come full circle.

43.speaker: Jaheira
43.text: 'The Blade of Frontiers'. A long way around just to finish where you started at, Wyll.

64.speaker: Minsc
64.text: 'The Blade of Frontiers'. Minsc understands, of course, but you might explain for Boo - this is the name you started with, yes?

135.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
135.text: I do not know how you can be the Blade of Frontiers again, after all we have seen and done. The past is dead.

28.speaker: Wyll
28.text: 'The Blade of Frontiers.' An old name for a new man.

98.speaker: Wyll
98.text: 'The Blade of Avernus.' A new name for a changed man.

76.speaker: Karlach
76.text: Well, well! You may get a curtsy out of me yet, Grand Duke Wyll Ravengard.

1.speaker: Wyll
1.text: Forget the curtsy. I'd rather share a cheap brown ale and a hunk of fresh venison. You in?

41.speaker: Player
41.text: Sounds heavenly. Mind if I join you?

16.speaker: Wyll
16.text: Not at all. You hunt the deer, I'll scrounge up the ale. Prepare your belly for roast a la Ravengard!

121.speaker: Wyll
121.text: Let's hope Gale doesn't take offence if I assume cooking duties, just the once.

117.speaker: Player
117.text: What are your plans, once you're instated as Grand Duke?

13.speaker: Wyll
13.text: If I'm to be a Grand Duke, I've got to greet the people and gain their trust.

35.speaker: Wyll
35.text: First, we mourn. We bow our heads for the fallen, and honour them by pledging peace.

157.speaker: Wyll
157.text: Next, we heal the city. We restore our broken buildings, stone by stone. We restore faith in each other, one good turn at a time.

144.speaker: Wyll
144.text: Then we open the gates to refugees, restore diplomatic ties. Baldur's Gate will again be the Jewel of the Coast.

80.speaker: Player
80.text: What are your plans? Where do I fit in your life as Grand Duke?

65.speaker: Wyll
65.text: I'll guide the city to a better future. Baldur's Gate will again be the Jewel of the Coast.

103.speaker: Wyll
103.text: And you? You'll be the Duke's consort. That is - if your heart so desires.

67.speaker: Wyll
67.text: Then let it be so. Could any man have wanted a partner more ravishing?

111.speaker: Wyll
111.text: You make me so proud. And when the elder brain falls, the people of Baldur's Gate will see what I see:

139.speaker: Wyll
139.text: A shining star, beckoning them to a brilliant future.

53.speaker: Player
53.text: That's not a choice I'm ready to make yet.

87.speaker: Wyll
87.text: Ah - the 'cross that bridge when we come to it' approach.

40.speaker: Wyll
40.text: Works for me. First we get to the killing. Then we get to the planning.

79.speaker: Player
79.text: I have other priorities, other plans for my life. I'm sorry.

42.speaker: Wyll
42.text: Gods. I thought - I thought this was our decision. That you'd remain at my side.
42.context: NodeContext: Upset, he's being broken up with

122.speaker: Wyll
122.text: Well. If our love must be a ghost, I won't fool myself into grasping for it.

125.speaker: Narrator
125.text: *Your minds briefly meet, bonded by parasite. You feel a flicker of sadness as Wyll's heart drops to his stomach.*

126.speaker: Wyll
126.text: But if I can't call you 'partner', I'm glad I can still call you 'friend'.

93.speaker: Player
93.text: Let's not get ahead of ourselves. We've got an elder brain to deal with.

100.speaker: Wyll
100.text: Of course. But we need nourishment, don't we? We can't go beating up brains on empty stomachs.

56.speaker: Player
56.text: Better make room for Mizora in that little party of yours.

138.speaker: Wyll
138.text: If you think I need a reminder she's holding my chains, think again. But that won't keep me from enjoying one festal meal, devil-free.

95.speaker: Player
95.text: What are your plans, once you're instated as Grand Duke?

12.speaker: Wyll
12.text: But let's leave those matters to the future. Right now, I've got a hankering for some gourmet grub.

133.speaker: Wyll
133.text: You hunt the meat, I'll scrounge up the ale. Prepare your belly for roast a la Ravengard!

81.speaker: Player
81.text: Eh, I'll leave you to it.

21.speaker: Wyll
21.text: Ah, too bad. Maybe you'll go changing your mind, once I've hunted some deer and scrounged up the ale.

78.speaker: Minsc
78.text: Wyll Ravengard! Eh - Boo usually advises Minsc in matters of politeness, but he is uncertain whether we ought to bow, or simply squeak an oath of allegiance...?

18.speaker: Wyll
18.text: Neither, brave Boo! How about we share a cheap brown ale and a hunk of fresh venison instead?

4.speaker: Minsc
4.text: Aha! You see, Boo? I told you the Rashemaar way was the right one.

2.speaker: Shadowheart
2.text: So, Grand Duke-to-be, is it? Should I bow? Or do a little curtsey perhaps?

116.speaker: Wyll
116.text: Forget the curtsy. I'd rather share a cheap brown ale and a hunk of fresh venison. You in?

75.speaker: Shadowheart
75.text: Of course. Sounds better than most noble feasts.

19.speaker: Astarion
19.text: Grand Duke Wyll Ravengard. Tell me, should I genuflect or merely bow?

99.speaker: Wyll
99.text: Forget the bowing. I'd rather share a cheap brown ale and a hunk of fresh venison. You in?

32.speaker: Astarion
32.text: I'll pass on the ale, but the company sounds delightful.

96.speaker: Wyll
96.text: Ah, there you are! I was thinking - I'm not Grand Duke just yet, but I'm still of a mind to celebrate.

90.speaker: Wyll
90.text: A hearty meal would do the trick. A few hunks of fresh venison, a round of brown ale - what do you say?

86.speaker: Wyll
86.text: Wonderful. You hunt the deer, I'll scrounge up the ale. Prepare your belly for roast a la Ravengard!

112.speaker: Player
112.text: Let's not get ahead of ourselves. We've got an elder brain to deal with, remember?

10.speaker: Player
10.text: Better make room for Mizora in that little party of yours.

123.speaker: Player
123.text: What are your plans, once you're instated as Grand Duke?

36.speaker: Player
36.text: Eh, I'll leave you to it.
